events.title: Wright Brothers' First Powered Flight
events.description: Orville and Wilbur Wright made the first controlled, sustained flight of a powered, heavier-than-air aircraft at Kitty Hawk, North Carolina.
events.significance: This event marked the beginning of modern aeronautics and the development of the aviation industry.

events.title: Fall of Romanian Dictator Nicolae Ceaușescu
events.description: Nicolae Ceaușescu and his wife Elena fled Bucharest as the Romanian Revolution took a decisive turn; they were later captured and executed on Christmas Day.
events.significance: This was a pivotal moment in the fall of communism in Eastern Europe and the end of a brutal dictatorship.

events.title: Congress Adopts the Articles of Confederation
events.description: The Continental Congress adopted the Articles of Confederation, the first constitution of the United States, establishing a form of national government.
events.significance: It laid the foundation for the governance of the newly independent United States before the current Constitution.

events.title: First Laser Invented by Theodore Maiman
events.description: The first working laser was demonstrated by physicist Theodore Maiman at Hughes Research Laboratories.
events.significance: This invention revolutionized technology, medicine, and communications, leading to numerous practical applications.

events.title: South Korean Naval Ship Sinks
events.description: The South Korean navy ship ROKS Cheonan sank near the disputed border with North Korea, causing the death of 46 sailors.
events.significance: The sinking escalated tensions between North and South Korea and led to international investigations and condemnation.
